metadata.Title: CVE-2020-8492 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
Python 2.7 through 2.7.17, 3.5 through 3.5.9, 3.6 through 3.6.10, 3.7 through 3.7.6, and 3.8 through 3.8.1 allows an HTTP server to conduct Regular Expression Denial of Service (ReDoS) attacks against a client because of urllib.request.AbstractBasicAuthHandler catastrophic backtracking.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-8492` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

idle-python2.7 - 2.7.17-1~18.04ubuntu1
libpython2.7 - 2.7.17-1~18.04ubuntu1
libpython2.7-minimal - 2.7.17-1~18.04ubuntu1
libpython2.7-stdlib - 2.7.17-1~18.04ubuntu1
libpython2.7-testsuite - 2.7.17-1~18.04ubuntu1
python2.7 - 2.7.17-1~18.04ubuntu1
python2.7-examples - 2.7.17-1~18.04ubuntu1
python2.7-minimal - 2.7.17-1~18.04ubuntu1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

idle-python3.6 - 3.6.9-1~18.04ubuntu1
libpython3.6 - 3.6.9-1~18.04ubuntu1
libpython3.6-minimal - 3.6.9-1~18.04ubuntu1
libpython3.6-stdlib - 3.6.9-1~18.04ubuntu1
libpython3.6-testsuite - 3.6.9-1~18.04ubuntu1
python3.6 - 3.6.9-1~18.04ubuntu1
python3.6-examples - 3.6.9-1~18.04ubuntu1
python3.6-minimal - 3.6.9-1~18.04ubuntu1
python3.6-venv - 3.6.9-1~18.04ubuntu1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

idle-python3.7 - 3.7.5-2ubuntu1~18.04.2
libpython3.7 - 3.7.5-2ubuntu1~18.04.2
libpython3.7-minimal - 3.7.5-2ubuntu1~18.04.2
libpython3.7-stdlib - 3.7.5-2ubuntu1~18.04.2
libpython3.7-testsuite - 3.7.5-2ubuntu1~18.04.2
python3.7 - 3.7.5-2ubuntu1~18.04.2
python3.7-examples - 3.7.5-2ubuntu1~18.04.2
python3.7-minimal - 3.7.5-2ubuntu1~18.04.2
python3.7-venv - 3.7.5-2ubuntu1~18.04.2
No subscription required

idle-python3.8 - 3.8.0-3ubuntu1~18.04.2
libpython3.8 - 3.8.0-3ubuntu1~18.04.2
libpython3.8-minimal - 3.8.0-3ubuntu1~18.04.2
libpython3.8-stdlib - 3.8.0-3ubuntu1~18.04.2
libpython3.8-testsuite - 3.8.0-3ubuntu1~18.04.2
python3.8 - 3.8.0-3ubuntu1~18.04.2
python3.8-examples - 3.8.0-3ubuntu1~18.04.2
python3.8-minimal - 3.8.0-3ubuntu1~18.04.2
python3.8-venv - 3.8.0-3ubuntu1~18.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: python2.7 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.7.17-1~18.04ubuntu1').
python3.6 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.6.9-1~18.04ubuntu1').
python3.7 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.7.5-2ubuntu1~18.04.2').
python3.8 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.8.0-3ubuntu1~18.04.2').
